content.raw:
We want to release [gazebo_ros_pkgs](https://github.com/osrf/gazebo_ros_pkgs) for Hydro and the freeze date is next week (June 29th). We need to decide how gazebo_ros_pkgs will depend on Gazebo for this release:

- Repackaged as a ROS package as its been done before
- Released into Ubuntu Universe

Is someone already working on this? I found this [Ubuntu packaging documentation](http://developer.ubuntu.com/packaging/html/).

Currently the [ROS build farm](http://ros.org/debbuild/hydro.html) has Gazebo 1.8.6 built for Hydro as a separate ROS package, though we need 1.9.0 for gazebo_ros to work correctly at runtime.
